basics.name: Jaron Reuel Ali
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: A software engineer with 3 years professional experience in full software development lifecycle at a small, dynamic leading designer and manufacturer of high-end audio equipment. Development experience ranges from mobile app development for iOS and Android to low-level embedded programming of microcontrollers and custom hardware. Organisational experience includes marketing final products at international trade fairs and leading recruiting of junior developers.

work.name: Cyrus Audio
work.summary: Software engineer in the R&D team, leading software projects spanning mobile app, embedded and Internet of Things (IoT) development. Responsible for development, management and deployment of software projects for the full suite of Cyrus hi-fi products.
highlights: App development: Full development lifecycle building multiple apps on both iOS and Android platforms as remote control points for hardware units. Used UPnP and Bluetooth LE for communication and Amazon Web Services (AWS) systems for data management. Responsible for deployment on Google Play Store & iTunes Connect. Languages: Java, Objective C, Swift. Toolchain: XCode, Android Studio.

Embedded development: Responsible for developing and maintaining embedded software on NXP Arm Cortex microcontrollers (MCU’s) to drive underlying hardware. Programming and controlling peripheral integrated circuits (IC’s) with MCU’s using serial communication protocols such as I2C, SPI, and UART.
Cloud & Development practices: Implemented AWS solutions and pioneered a program to uplift development practices to integrate Agile techniques, test-driven-development and robust documentation.

Marketing: Leading demonstrations and speeches unveiling new products in European hi-fi shows including Munich, Bristol and Paris. Visiting hi-fi retailers on a UK tour giving bespoke product demonstrations to customers.
Recruiting: Organising the yearly programme for university internships joining the R&D team.

courses: 2015: Dissertation project - Reprocessing Star Trail Photography - using transformations caused by rotation of the earth to infer original stellar images with the star trail effect removed, achieved using MATLAB.

2014: Year-long Java software engineering group project building a flight control simulation game - received department award for final project and ran a software demo and presentation of project on University open days.
2013: Co-authored a research paper on a human-computer interactions experiment that was published in CHI ’13 Extended Abstracts on Human Factors in Computing Systems.
A-Levels: Maths (A);  Further Maths to AS (A); English (B);  Physics (C).
GCSE: 12 passes: 5 A* grades and 7 A grades.

publications.name: Attention, time perception and immersion in games
publications.publisher: CHI EA '13: CHI '13 Extended Abstracts on Human Factors in Computing Systems
publications.summary: In this work in progress, we describe an attempt to investigate the relationship between immersion and time perception.

projects.name: Head Boy at Sherrardswood School,
projects.description: Responsible for whole-school charity events, presentations and speeches to staff, parents and students

projects.name: Work shadowing at Goldman Sachs
projects.description: including visiting a large-scale data centre to learn about free-cooling techniques and the operational challenges of running mission-critical systems at scale.
